definition: to study/to engage in scholarship

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
to ask

sentences.english: I have not the gifts that are necessary for scholarship.
sentences.chinese: 浅尝辄止的人是无法做学问的。

sentences.english: Time to concentrate on studying is a good way of learning.
sentences.chinese: 惜时专心苦读是做学问的一个好方法。

sentences.english: This is a place where scholarship can not fat ad?
sentences.chinese: 这是做学问的地方，能不能不发广告？

sentences.english: Prof. Luo is my lifelong apotheosis in personality and in academic fields.
sentences.chinese: 无论是做人还是做学问，罗师都是我一生的典范。

sentences.english: His whole life is devoted to learning.
I was a scholar, a specialist.
sentences.chinese: 我是个做学问的，一个专家。

sentences.english: Is there anything difficult for us to study ?
sentences.chinese: 我们做学问有困难和容易的区别吗？

definition: scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study

learning/knowledge/CL:個|个[ge4]
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to teach (in a school)
to take an official post/to become a government employee

holy book
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
scholar/intellectual
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
to pay no attention to outside matters

definition: to write a book
diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
